intro: Majana arabica, commonly known as the Arabian coffee plant, is a species native to the Arabian Peninsula. It is a small evergreen shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its glossy dark green leaves and small white flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain the seeds used for coffee production. It thrives in tropical climates with well-drained soil and requires a humid environment. Due to its limited natural range, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
